result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devon Michael Garza

records.addlTxt:
3:46 PM Defendant Devon Michael Garza in court, in custody.  Attorney Jake Gondik in court for Devon Michael Garza.  Attorney Mark Fruehauf for Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. State requests motion be granted to terminate deferred agreement in 20CF406 and order a PSI. In 22CF163, asks that matter be set for jury trial. Attorney Gondik in agreement. Court grants motion to terminate DJOC in 20CF406 and orders a PSI. In 22CF163, Court sets jury and pre-trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 20, 2023 at 03:00 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for February 7, 2023 at 08:00 am.

9:30 AM Prosecuting attorney Chad C La Lor in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Devon Michael Garza appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Garrett Gondik in court for Richard S Gondik Jr in court for Devon Michael Garza. Court calls cases 20CF406 and 22CF163. Court notes older file will need to be set for sentencing. State indicates offer has been extended and defense will be sending counteroffer. Asks for newer case to track with older file. Attorney Gondik is in agreement and indicates that he is waiting on medical records.
Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Premises of 3806 Tower Ave #29 Superior, WI, Any items that may be evidence in the substantial battery of Makenzie Carroll, Blood Evidence, Indicia of residency, and/or cellular telephones

8:37 AM Defendant Devon Michael Garza appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jacob Gondik in court for Devon Michael Garza. Attorney Mark Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Acknowledge receipt, waive reading, enter pleas of not guilty. Needs time to go over discovery and speak to client. Court accepts pleas.
Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

1:38 PM Defendant Devon Michael Garza appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jacob Gondik in court for Richard S Gondik Jr in court for Devon Michael Garza.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases 20CF406 and 22CF163. Attorney J. Gondik indicates that there is a stipulation between the parties. State and Attorney Gondik asks that under 940.47, an order be signed in both cases prohibiting contact with Victim 1, with the exception of third party contact for purposes of child custody. In 20CF406, the DJOC amended conditions to allow contact between the defendant and victim.  Court clarifies the requests of the parties. Attorney Gondik and his client stipulate on the record that malicious contact has occurred or is likely to occur as stated in 940.47. Court will sign proposed orders in both cases. In both files the no contact is in effect. The above no contact shall have the exception that Defendant may have third party contact only for the purposes of child custody or placement. 20CF406, bond is amended to reflect the change. Bond in 22CF163 remains unchanged by the order.
Transcript of Preliminary Hearing on May 18, 2022
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
8:22 AM Defendant Devon Michael Garza in court, in custody.  Attorney Richard S Gondik Jr in court for Devon Michael Garza.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. No victim appeared via Zoom.  Court calls case. Exhibit 1 marked. Attorney Gondik asks for sequestration. State calls witness, Officer Gregory Mertzig, S/T. State-direct examination of witness. May 2, 2022, Tower Avenue, City of Superior, Douglas County Wisconsin. Called to a disturbance with unconscious female, hit with bottle.  Witness identifies Defendant.  Court notes identification of witness. Continued questioning by State. Objection, narrative. Overruled. Continued questioning. Attorney cross examines witness. Objection, relevance, overruled. Continued questioning. Objection, relevance, sustained. Continued questioning. Objection, vague, sustained. No redirect. State moves for admission of Exhibit 1, no objection. Judicial notice taken of Exhibit 1. Exhibit 1 received. 
State rests. 

State makes argument for bind over. Attorney makes argument in opposition.
Court finds probable cause and binds the Defendant over for Arraignment. 
Court reminds the Defendant of their bail conditions. Defendant orally confirms they have received date and time of hearing and confirms they will attend. Defendant provided notice.
Arraignment scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No contact with victim 1.  3rd party contact only for the purposes of child custody or placement.

1:30 PM Defendant Devon Michael Garza in court, in custody.  Attorney Jacob Gondik in court for Devon Michael Garza.  Attorney Peter Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant's address confirmed. Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading. States request on bail: $10,000 cb. No contact with victim 1 except 3rd party contact.
High potential penalties, same victim on deferred judg of conviction continuing violent allegations, DOC hold, likely to revoke. 
Atty Gondik requests $10,000 signature bond because he made all appearance on $5000 signature bond. Court cited concerns, severe charges, on DJOC on probation and same victim. 
Court orders $5000.00 cash bail. No contact with victim 1 contact only thru 3rd party for custody or placement purposes.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
